metadata.Title: CVE-2018-20549 on Ubuntu 14.04 ESM (trusty) - medium.
metadata.Description:
There is an illegal WRITE memory access at caca/file.c (function caca_file_read) in libcaca 0.99.beta19.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2018-20549` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

caca-utils - 0.99.beta18-1ubuntu5.1
libcaca0 - 0.99.beta18-1ubuntu5.1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: libcaca package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '0.99.beta18-1ubuntu5.1').
